meanings.definition: A book containing rules and guidelines for writing and formatting documents.
meanings.sent1: I always refer to my stylebooks when I need to check the correct way to format my essays.
meanings.sent2: Writers often use stylebooks to ensure consistency in their writing.
meanings.sent3: My stylebooks and I have a love-hate relationship; they help me, but they can be so strict!
meanings.sent4: In the world of writing, stylebooks are like the wise elders guiding the younger generation of writers.
meanings.sent5: The stylebooks on my shelf are like treasure maps leading me to the right writing path.

meanings.definition: A collection of rules and standards for a particular type of writing or publication.
meanings.sent1: The journalism department has a set of stylebooks for students to follow in their articles.
meanings.sent2: Editors rely on stylebooks to maintain consistency in the magazine's content.
meanings.sent3: When the stylebooks go missing, chaos ensues in the editorial office!
meanings.sent4: To writers, stylebooks are like the compass guiding them through the vast sea of words.
meanings.sent5: The stylebooks in the library are like guardians protecting the integrity of writing.
